Package arithmetic

Examples of programme proofs and of assertions in Java.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Cube
    Defines a method for calculating the cube of an integer.
    ReadInt
    Provides a facility for reading an integer from the input.
    Square
    Defines a method for calculating the square of an integer.

Package arithmetic Description

Examples of programme proofs and of assertions in Java.

The square class implements the square method form the lecture, and includes Java assertions based on the programme proof from the lecture. Try running the square class (it includes a main method). Now try introducing deliberate errors and run it again. If you don't see an assertion error it may be that you have not enabled assertions in the virtual machine. See the practical notes and/or video for details on how to enable assertions.

The cube class contains an implementation of a cube methods similar to the swuare methods in the square class. This time, however, there are no assertions. You should develop a proof of the cube method. You could then add assertions mirroring your proof to the cube class, and try running it with and without deliberate errors.

PLEASE NOTE: The fact that a programme with assertions runs without errors is NOT a proof that the programme is correct. The proof comes from human understanding of the proof, probably helped by elucidations and justifications of the assertions in the proof.
